newsitem.title: USA: Mortgage-backeds contained to narrow ranges in U.S.
newsitem.headline: Mortgage-backeds contained to narrow ranges in U.S.

text.p: Mortgage-backed securities (MBS) were little changed and confined to narrow trading bands at midday Tuesday, mimicking the Treasury market's tone before the $38 billion refunding got under way.
MBS yield spreads above Treasuries remained stable after widening in recent weeks on escalated prepayment fears, traders said.

"I don't know if the market sentiment has changed, but people are more comfortable owning" a broader spectrum of MBS after Friday's rate surge quelled some prepayment worries, said a trader of adjustable-rate mortgage securities.

"There are a lot of people still reeling from Friday's employment report. They are trying to understand the data and the decline in Treasury prices," said William Gooch, vice president at Legg Mason Wood Walker. He added that investors who were concerned about prepayments prior to the report may now be reconsidering a move out of mortgages or down-in-coupon.
"A lot of people are in a wait-and-see mode," said Gooch, noting that investor enthusiasm about the auction of 10-year notes and 30-year bonds will affect MBS spreads.
